author: Special Correspondent
text:
Arputham Ammal, mother of A.G. Perarivalan - one of the seven convicts in the Rajiv Gandhi assassination case - submitted a petition to the Chief Minister’s cell on Wednesday seeking her son’s release at least for Pongal this year.

Talking to reporters after submitting the petition, Ms. Arputham Ammal recalled her son’s petition to the Governor on December 30 requesting to facilitate his release under Article 161 of the Constitution and hoped that Chief Minister Jayalalithaa would facilitate his release on January 17, the birth anniversary of AIADMK founder M.G. Ramachandran.

“The Chief Minister’s reassurance that my son would soon be released and come to me is still fresh in my memory and with that hope, I am up on my feet. The Law Department and the Justice Department have betrayed me. I am hoping that the Chief Minister would help in the release of my son,” she said.

25 years behind bars

Perarivalan has been in prison for more than 25 years since the inquiry began in the case.

“If he is not released, this will be the 25th Pongal he will not be spending with us. I am 69, my husband is 74 years old and diabetic. We hope to see our son live with us at least during our last years,” said Arputham Ammal, as tears coursed down her cheeks.

A day after the death sentence of the convicts was commuted by the Supreme Court in February 2014, the State government adopted a resolution in the Assembly that the convicts be released. However, the Centre had moved the apex court and obtained a stay.

Submits petition to Chief Minister’s cell seeking his release
title: Arputham Ammal submits plea to CM
